explanation: The analysis of try_get_value regarding the MISRA C rule on string handling requires knowledge of the behavior and implementation guarantees of the following symbols: 1. strlen: Used to measure key length; must not read beyond string bounds. 2. strstr: Used to locate key occurrences; must not access memory beyond the buffer strings. 3. strchr: Used to find the terminating quote; must respect bounds to avoid overreads. 4. malloc: Used to allocate destination buffer; needed to verify correctness of allocated size and avoid buffer overflow. 5. memcpy: Copies extracted substring into destination; correctness depends on valid source and destination pointers and appropriate length. Understanding these ensures that calls to string.h functions do not result in out-of-bounds accesses or buffer overruns within try_get_value.
